Reviews.Title: Poor quality - broken audio-in
Reviews.Author: WantItNow2Go
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these from "The Wiz" (not Amazon), but I'm reviewing it here because The Wiz no longer carries this model.For a 19" 720p LED screen, I thought the picture was really lacking (I did get my eyes checked at about the same time, and it was not my eyes that's the problem!).  Right from the start, the sound was "tinny", no matter how many adjustments I made to the Setup.  So, I bought a set of external speakers with a woofer, and the sound was better.  Then, after about six months, the "audio-out" (that the speakers were plugged into) stopped working.  I checked the speakers on a different piece of equipment, and the speakers were fine; so, the problem is the TV unit.  Of course, it's beyond the labor warranty (only 90 days), and only the parts warranty (one year) applies now; so, we'll see how much they will cover to fix this.  In any case, they charge $25 for return shipping on ANY warranty work.  That sucks!  I would NOT recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: It is good for the price
Reviews.Author: Yoiyumtewa
Reviews.Content: Once of the Cheapest LED out there. The picture is crisp and the sound quality is great. maybe the 22" was built different than the 19" . overall , for the price, i think it is very good purchase.

ProductInfo.Features:
22-Inch widescreen LED HDTV with an attractive super-slim profile fits anywhere
Energy efficient technology meets Energy Star 3.0 and California Energy Commission standards (standby power <1W),Extended backlight life expectancy (20,000 hours)
Built-in digital TV tuner (ATSC/NTSC/ QAM),  HDMI digital connection delivers perfect signal transmission
PC VGA connection for use as a computer monitor, Digital noise reduction and film-mode detection
V-chip parental control, Closed- Caption, and Electronic Program Guide support,  Multi-language on-screen display
ProductInfo.Name: Coby LEDTV2235 22-Inch LED HDTV (Black)
